overall_theme: February 2026 is a compressed, cycle-dense month across all assets. Multiple geopolitical and cyclical catalysts converge, particularly around the Feb 17-20 window. 2026 is designated as a 'panic year' with potential for shock events. Risk management is paramount.

2026-02-17-20: S&P500 (CRITICAL RISK WINDOW - multiple cycle convergence)

sp500.bias: Slightly negative seasonally, but first half has mild upward tilt
top_insights: 8 consecutive months of gains - D9 indicator at level 8 (extreme)
MACD below action line during rally = weakness signal (same pattern preceded Jan-Feb 2025 correction)
2026 is a designated 'panic year' - expect a shock event
Iran 45-year cycle, Russia financial trigger risk, Japan 36-year cycle all converge
Mandatory: max 1% risk per trade, 30% cash reserves, stop-losses on all positions
sp500.summary: After 8 months of gains, S&P shows exhaustion with RSI/MACD divergences. Primary trend still bullish but Feb 17-20 is a critical risk window with geopolitical and cyclical convergence. Defense and cash preservation are key.

bitcoin.bias: Seasonally bearish, but 60% positive close rate (limited 15-year history)
top_insights: Down ~40% from Oct 2025 peak following 35-month rise / 14-month decline cycle
Broke $80,500 November support - structural weakness confirmed
Narrowing wedge on daily chart - breakout direction uncertain
Weekly chart signals possible deep correction lasting 100-150 weeks
Feb 17 vs Feb 6: 100% of years Bitcoin traded higher (9/9)
bitcoin.summary: Bitcoin in critical long-term test zone after 40% decline. Wedge pattern building on daily chart. Break above $95K = bullish, break below $84.4K then $80.6K = deeper correction. Feb 16-19 window expected to be particularly volatile.

eurusd.bias: Slightly bearish - 65% probability of decline from Feb 20 to March 1
top_insights: Unusual cluster of daily turning points Feb 1-11 (high volatility expected)
Weekly breakout at 1.1920 showed shooting star candle - possible failed breakout
Feb 6: 73% decline probability | Feb 9: 76% rise | Feb 10: 85% decline
1.1772-1.1814 is the critical decision zone on daily chart
Feb 17 aligns with weekly cycle - potentially significant trend change
eurusd.summary: EUR/USD faces bearish seasonal pressure with a dense cluster of turning points in early February. The 1.1772-1.1814 zone is the make-or-break level. Hold = bullish continuation; break = deeper correction toward 1.1390.

gold.bias: Slightly positive seasonally - February favorable for Gold
top_insights: Primary uptrend intact despite ~20% correction - no confirmed reversal
$4,381 is the critical weekly support with 6 candles above it
Two price/time cycles converge from midmonth - very favorable
Fibonacci and seasonal timing converge around Feb 13 - buyers expected
Elliott Wave analysis: wave 5 upward cycle may be starting
gold.summary: Gold correcting within intact primary uptrend. $4,381 is the line in the sand - hold = bullish, break = correction to $3,886. Feb 13 is a high-conviction buying zone with Fibonacci and seasonal convergence. Feb is seasonally favorable.

oil.bias: Slightly positive seasonally - 60% close higher late Feb to early March
top_insights: Every rally is still a correction until $70 is reclaimed and $80 confirmed
$64.40-$66.50 resistance band is the critical ceiling since September
$55.36-$56 support has held through 4 tests since April
2 of 3 decade patterns point upward
NO open Oil positions over weekends - surprise risk highest in Oil
oil.summary: Oil trapped between $55-56 support and $64-66 resistance. Mild seasonal upward bias but no trend change until $70+ confirmed. Feb 12-13 is the strongest turning window with decade pattern alignment.

cross_asset_themes: Feb 3 is a turning point across ALL 5 assets - expect significant market-wide movement
Feb 17-20 window is critical for S&P500, Bitcoin, EUR/USD - multiple cycles converge
Geopolitical catalysts: Iran 45-year cycle, Russia financial trigger, Japan 36-year cycle
2026 designated as 'panic year' - prepare for shock events similar to COVID-type disruptions
Risk management is paramount: mandatory stops, reduced position sizes, cash reserves
risk_management_rules: Oil: NO open positions over weekends
All assets: mandatory stop-loss within system
End of week: reduce to half position size with no leverage
Do not chase price moves in compressed time windows
All dates may deviate +/- 1 trading day
